poem:
Title: In the Wake of a Fiscal Dawn 

Britain, beneath shrouded mist, her purse in plight,
Chancellors, past and future, tremble at the sight.
A gulf of £30bn, gaping, screams in the night,
A spectre that growth nor borrowing might right.
As the International Fund delivers its spiteful bite,
Should we gamble, should we fight?
Or in resignation, let austerity ignite.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
